#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Become a Window Dresser
#Text=Window dressers , also called retail merchandisers or visual merchandisers , create window displays in stores to draw customers in and increase sales .
#Text=Retail is a competitive industry , so it takes artistic skill , technical ability , training and hard work to break into this field , and there is more than one way to do it .

#Text=Increasingly , stores look for degrees in retail or graphic design , but practical experience , self marketing and keeping up with artistic skills can all be factors in finding a job and learning more about how to become a window dresser .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Decide whether to seek visual merchandising employment in a large retail environment or self employment as a freelance window dresser .
#Text=Retail chains offer more stability , pay and benefits , but the work may be focused more on technical skills and the marketing aspect of retail merchandising than artistic vision .
#Text=Find out what experience and education are required for the type of work being sought to determine how to become a window dresser in that specific field .
#Text=Retail chains may look for more of a retail or management training and experience , for example , while freelance work in the area may focus more on visual and artistic work .
#Text=Get a job in a retail store , even if it 's not as a window dresser .
#Text=This is a good way to learn about the retail environment and see what it 's like to work in a store .
#Text=Part time and seasonal jobs are fairly easy to get , even without experience .
#Text=Students enrolled in a retail merchandising school can look for jobs as apprentices or interns that are offered either independently or through the school .
#Text=Take design classes .
#Text=There are many traditional and online certificate programs , associate degrees or bachelor 's degrees offered .
#Text=Courses in retail merchandising , graphic design and set design can help land a job and will provide access to career guidance and internships .
#Text=Volunteer to dress windows at small stores , boutiques and restaurants .
#Text=This will generate publicity and add to your portfolio .
#Text=Keep up with trends in fashion and design .
#Text=Subscribe to magazines and online blogs .
#Text=Gather tools to do the job , especially for volunteer or freelance work .
#Text=Inexpensive party decorations and seasonal items can be used over and over again to create store displays .
#Text=Market and publicize your creative endeavors and any displays that you help to create as a volunteer or on the job .
#Text=Try to get local press to cover some of the window displays .
#Text=Use a website and social networking tools like blogs and Twitter to show off your work .
#Text=Find inspiration everywhere .
#Text=Get in the habit of visualizing displays and arrangements when looking at items .
#Text=Check out popular store window displays , and read articles and blogs by window dressers and others in the field of visual merchandising .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Previous retail experience is essential in order to become a visual merchandiser .
#Text=VMs may also be required to undertake other store duties in addition to improving store appearance
